p: In this context, the peculiar activity of ferutinin might be due to the association with the prominent affinity of ferutinin for estrogen receptors GPER, which are present on the platelet membranes [ 59, 62, 63]. In fact, the estrogenic regulation of platelets is independent of genomic regulation exerted by nuclear receptors ERα and ERβ, since the platelet are anuclear blood elements.
